qas.question: In which hemisphere does bird migration primarily happen?
Where do birds from high northern latitutes migrate to?
Why do birds migrate south in winter?
Which species of seabirds are more likely to migrate?
Why are seabirds from the southern hemisphere more likely to migrate?

answers.text: there is a large area of ocean in the Southern Hemisphere

context: Bird migration is primarily, but not entirely, a <a0_0>Northern<a0_0/> Hemisphere phenomenon. This is because land birds in high northern latitudes, where <a2_0>food becomes scarce<a2_0/> in winter, leave for areas further <a1_0>south<a1_0/> (including the Southern Hemisphere) to overwinter, and because the continental landmass is much larger in the Northern Hemisphere. In contrast, among (pelagic) seabirds, <a3_0>species of the Southern Hemisphere<a3_0/> are more likely to migrate. This is because <a4_0>there is a large area of ocean in the Southern Hemisphere<a4_0/>, and more islands suitable for seabirds to nest.
